title: Introduction to texor
text: texor proposed package can help converting old LaTeX based documents, research papers HTML intermediate conversions. particularly problem R Research papers HTML export available hence modern compatibility export HTML file missed . bring documents online HTML based webpages much better alternative opposed PDFs solve lack web versions texor provide mechanism.

title: Introduction to texor
text: stage, check basics like using correct path, normalizing path,extracting file_name/ wrapper_name etc..
code: # normalizing path using xfun package dir <- xfun::normalize_path(dir)  # getting wrapper file name wrapper_file <- texor::get_wrapper_type(dir)  # getting the main LaTeX file name file_name <- texor::get_texfile_name(dir)

title: Introduction to texor
text: Pandoc need, style files trying compile, rather convert. Hence, workaround certain limitations, remove RJournal.sty file include new style file redefines certain commands.
code: # This function will remove RJournal.sty file, # Copy the Metafix.sty file and link it in wrapper. texor::include_style_file(dir)

title: Introduction to texor
text: desire embedded bibliography included div element article , need convert Bibtex format. removing bibliography div elements article use Lua filter later . converting embedded bibliography use rebib package. default set bibliography aggregation function, logically create/update bibtex file include article_tex_file well (linked).
code: # bibliography aggregation when both bibtex and embedded bibliography available, # Using Bibtex file for bibliography if no embedded bibliography available, # Create a new bibtex file using the embedded bibliography in the document. rebib::aggregate_bibliography(dir)

title: Introduction to texor
text: Texor package creates yaml report figure environments, including tikz, algorithm2e images. also logical function uses pandoc’s Image data converting PDF images PNG.

title: Introduction to texor
text: Pandoc support certain environments, like: figures : figure*, algorithmic, algorithm. table : table*. code : example, example*, Sin, Sout, Scode, Sinput, Soutput, smallverbatim, boxedverbatim. , texor use stream editor patch environments default types figure,table verbatim. also function patch equations (especially eqnarray environment).

what: Stage 5 : Converting the LaTeX document to Markdown
title: Introduction to texor
text: convert document Markdown, lot Lua filters modifying document. pre_conversion statistics read article find statistical elements like figure, table, code blocks, citations etc.

title: Introduction to texor
text: function copy files figures kinds, bibtex file, pdfs etc. /web folder.

what: Stage 7 : Converting the Markdown to Rmarkdown
title: Introduction to texor
text: stage convert markdown Rmarkdown reading adding metadata information like ctv,CRANpkgs,BIOpkgs,slug,author metadata, title, abstract,etc.. also add important parameters rjtools::rjournal_web_article like: self_contained = TRUE toc = FALSE legacy_pdf = TRUE web_only = TRUE mathjax = “https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/mathjax@3/es5/tex-chtml-full.js”

what: Stage 8 : Creating RJ-web-article from the Rmarkdown file
title: Introduction to texor
Figure-Environement
text: Images essential component article, However due differences support various graphic formats LaTeX markdown/HTML need fallback raster graphics. Image Format support various Markup/Typesetting Languages can observe table, raster (PNG JPG) images relatively easy handle require additional pre-processing. Pandoc handles well. PNG,JPG images easily included markdown images captions, labels parameters. image formats like tikz algorithm, first isolated compiled PDF, PNG using pdftools package.

what: For the best results after conversion :
title: Figure-Environement
text: Avoid using framebox latex command wrap \includegraphics{} . might interfere packages ability properly read path copy relevant image properly. Try keep actual content caption without LaTeX markup (normal text), reflected HTML properly. example :

title: Table-Environment
text: Tables commonly used RJ articles display data tabular format. However, differences way tables handled LaTeX HTML. LaTeX tables customization usually optimized printing, whereas web articles need tables optimized varying sizes media. pandoc converts tables somewhat easily, unable well table customization packages complex tables. pandoc extensions used order tackle , : simple_tables, pipe_tables Limited Multicolumn support included. example illustrates complicated table, texor package can handle subroutines pre-processing step transform LaTeX code. Stream Editor modifies \multicolumn{..} \multicolumnx{..} LaTeX macro redefines \multicolumnx{..} \multicolumn{---}, accepted pandoc. Finally pandoc reads table transforms markdown. Also note stream editor used rename table* environment table environment markdown/HTML support specific changes table* environment bring. Resulting Markdown Generated look like :
code: \begin{table*}[t!] \begin{center} \begin{tabular}{l | llll }  \hline  \multicolumn{1}{c |}{EXAMPLE} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{$X$} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{$Y$} \\  \hline   & 1 & 2 & 1 & 2 \\  EX1  & X11 & X12 &  Y11  & Y12 \\  EX2  & X21 & X22 &  Y21  & Y22 \\  EX3  & X31 & X32 &  Y31  & Y32 \\  EX4  & X41 & X42 &  Y41  & Y42\\  EX5  & X51 & X52 &  Y51  & Y52 \\ \hline \end{tabular} \label{table1} \caption{An Example Table with Multicolumn} \end{center} \end{table*} ::: center ::: {#table1}   -------------------------------------   EXAMPLE   \(X\)         \(Y\)      --------- ------- ----- ------- -----             1       2     1       2    EX1       X11     X12   Y11     Y12    EX2       X21     X22   Y21     Y22    EX3       X31     X32   Y31     Y32    EX4       X41     X42   Y41     Y42    EX5       X51     X52   Y51     Y52   -------------------------------------    : Table 1: An Example Table with Multicolumn :::  []{#table1 label="table1"} :::

what: How are code blocks handled by texor
title: Code-Environment
text: Pandoc naturally converts verbatim environment easily, however redefination commands example, example*, Sinput etc verbatim work well pandoc. Hence Texor package uses stream editor search find replace matching code environments verbatim pandoc touches . way code lost conversion, also pandoc extension used add attributes markdown code using ’fenced_code_attributes`

previous_headings: How are code blocks handled by texor
title: Code-Environment
text: Code Environment support texor Note special markup (like font-size, font-style) bought code environments lost, However retained text syntax highlighting (R default, want change syntax highlighting, change language markdown source code formed)

title: Math-Environment
text: Math typesetting always LaTeX’s highlight feature, making de facto choice among academicians researchers globally. However, proceed humble web interfaces, math hard describe traditionally. advancements JavaScript libraries better Typeset present math web pages LaTeX commands/math functions available. texor package uses Mathjax version 31 enhance visual look math content HTML. support equations, inline math, equation numbering.

title: Converting LaTeX `RJournal` Articles into RJ-web-articles
text: texor package deals multiple challenges occour conversion LaTeX source files (typically generate PDF) web friendly RJ-web-article format.

what: Currently texor can handle R-Journal structured LaTeX files with support for:
title: Converting LaTeX `RJournal` Articles into RJ-web-articles
text: RJournal based LaTeX files macros \pkg{},\CRANpkg{},\BIOpkg{}, \code{}, \acronym{} Reading Metadata LaTeX file well DESCRIPTION. Reading bibliography bibtex files ignoring \thebibliography Supports code environments like Sinput,Soutput, example ,example*,verbatim, smallverbatim code highlight. Supports graphics included PDF, PNG, JPG, tikz, algorithm2e graphics supported (figures might work). Functions convert PDF graphics PNG. Almost tables supported exceptions. things like citations,links,footnotes,math,CTV,package references also supported. parser read minimally convert inbuilt \thebibliography bibtex (moved rebib) Figure/Table/Equation numbering Stream Editor rename alien commands/environments accepted defaults. Pre Post conversion statistics environments verification. Bibliography aggregation.(moved rebib) Tikz,algorithm graphics supported (figures might work) Logging events.

title: Converting LaTeX `RJournal` Articles into RJ-web-articles
text: install mainline version CRAN : install development version GitHub :

title: Converting LaTeX `RJournal` Articles into RJ-web-articles
text: quick example use texor package sample RJournal article (included package inst/article)
code: # for a single LaTeX article  texor::latex_to_web(article_dir) # for multiple articles in RJ folder structure  #base dir  article_dir <- "C:/Users/abhis/Documents/projects/gsoc-2022/original" # list of journal number directories journal_dirs <- list.dirs(article_dir,recursive = FALSE) # list of individual slug directories slug_dirs <- lapply(journal_dirs,function(journal_dir) {     list.dirs(journal_dir,recursive = FALSE) }) # creating a single list of all slug directories slug_dirs <- unlist(slug_dirs) # Calling  for (dir in slug_dirs) {     #print(dir)     getwd()     # below function will create a log file of success/error in current     # working directory while running the texor::latex_to_web() function     texor::convert_to_html(dir) }

title: convert LaTeX wrapper to markdown — convert_to_markdown
code: # Note This is a minimal example to execute this function article_dir <- system.file("examples/article",                  package = "texor") texor::include_style_file(article_dir) #> [1] TRUE texor::convert_to_markdown(article_dir) #> [1] "RJwrapper.tex" #> [1] "/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article/RJwrapper.tex" #> [1] "/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article" #> [1] "RJwrapper.md" #> [1] "/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article/RJwrapper.md" #> /usr/local/bin/pandoc +RTS -K512m -RTS /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article/RJwrapper.tex --to markdown-simple_tables-pipe_tables-fenced_code_attributes --from latex --output /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article/RJwrapper.md -s --resource-path /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/abs_filter.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/bib_filter.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/image_filter.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/R_code.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/image_caption.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/table_caption.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/conversion_compat_check.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/equation_filter.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/bookdown_ref.lua --citeproc  #> Detected the following packages from article: #>   CRAN:  #>   Bioconductor:

title: count inline elements — count_inline

title: count inline elements — count_inline
code:
article_dir <- system.file("examples/article",                  package = "texor") math <- texor::count_inline(article_dir, "math") code <- texor::count_inline(article_dir, "inlinecode") cite <- texor::count_inline(article_dir, "cite") print(paste("math inlines : ", math, "
",             "code inlines : ", code, "
",             "citations    : ", cite)) #> [1] "math inlines :  2 
 code inlines :  0 
 citations    :  2"

code: # Note This is a minimal example to execute this function article_dir <- system.file("examples/article",                  package = "texor") texor::include_style_file(article_dir) #> NULL texor::convert_to_markdown(article_dir) #> [1] "RJwrapper.tex" #> [1] "/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article/RJwrapper.tex" #> [1] "/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article" #> [1] "RJwrapper.md" #> [1] "/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article/RJwrapper.md" #> /usr/local/bin/pandoc +RTS -K512m -RTS /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article/RJwrapper.tex --to markdown-simple_tables-pipe_tables-fenced_code_attributes --from latex --output /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article/RJwrapper.md -s --resource-path /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/examples/article --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/abs_filter.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/bib_filter.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/image_filter.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/R_code.lua --lua-filter /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/texor/image_caption.lua --lua-filter #>   Bioconductor:  texor::generate_rmd(article_dir) texor::copy_other_files(article_dir) #> /usr/local/bin/pandoc +RTS -K512m -RTS code: wd <-  system.file("examples/article", package = "texor") texor::log_setup(wd, "log-file.log", "texor" , 2) texor::texor_log("Hello", "INFO", 2) #> NULL cat(readLines(paste(wd,"/log-file.log",sep="")),sep="\n") #> INFO [2023-05-28 18:05:25] Hello

title: Version 1.0.0
text: Algorithm figures now numbered. Added boxedverbatim support code environments. Included web_only parameter embedding PDF using Rmarkdown produce HTML. Updated MathJax Version3 added -tex_math_single_backslash extension pandoc better math handling. Support sample articles without directory structure required RJ articles. Updated Instructions examples. Updated contributor information. examples test cases.

title: Version 1.0.0
text: Using xfun::normalize_path() instead normalizePath() relative/absolute path handling Stream editor also works algorithm environments. Fixed image sizing paramaters. New algorithm find, convert copy images appropriately. Fixed bug , metadata$address missing metadata$author used author name. Removes RJournal.sty file conflicts inner workings pandoc. Fixed file extension editing using xfun::with_ext() instead gsub(). precise title description.

title: Version 0.6.9
text: Added algorithm2e graphics support (beta) (GitHub Issue #32) Added tikz graphics support (GitHub Issue #7) Added automation workflow separate logger logging success failure conversion.

title: Version 0.6.9
text: Fixing equation labeling issue , ., _ equations also added eq: equation starts present. Added support relative paths Fixed bugs figure parser new regex. Fixed tikz lib extraction method

title: Version 0.6.9
text: Removing old bibliographic parser/converter texor favour new implementation rebib supports many features.

title: Version 0.6.7
text: Equation labeling numbering Code/table/equation/figure pre-processors fixed many meta data related issues now use Mathjax V3 New testthat test cases pkgdown website texor::latex_to_web() single article new stat tools metrics conversion coverage check environment/word count pandoc convert

title: Version 0.6.7
text: Support absolute paths Fixed lot logic errors Fixed incompatibilities removed unnecessary code features R-CMD-check passing Github workflows work now Improved stat filter exports pre post conversion stats yaml file namespaces logger URL fix non http:// web Links Figure max width : 100% extra option added figures. fixed pre processing tikz fixed problems journal volume comment filter mechanism latex improved lua filter numbering centering figures fixed slug issue

title: Version 0.5.9
text: Automated orchestration conversion New stream editor R Using stream editor instead lua filter code Using stream editor instead GNU sed table changes lua filter R code Using stream editor figure environment patching Automatic fetching volume issue folder

title: Version 0.5.9
text: Support absolute paths fixed(almost functions) Fixed logic errors Fixes metafix.sty

title: Version 0.5.5
text: Placeholder abstract text articles missing abstract \CRANpkg(),\BIOpkg() CRAN_TASK_VIEWS supported Tables numbering new lua filter numbering tables Patched Metafix.sty vignettes

title: Version 0.5.2
text: package matures point almost features working, soon ready CRAN deployment. following features working: LaTeX macros \pkg,\CRANpkg,\code supported. Reading Metadata LaTeX file well DESCRIPTION. Reading bibliography bibtex files ignoring \thebibliography parser read convert inbuilt \thebibliography bibtex Supports code environments like Sinput,Soutput, example ,example*,verbatim code highlight. Supports graphics included PDF,PNG,JPG. Functions convert PDF graphics PNG. Almost tables converted exceptions. things like citations,links,footnotes,math(limited) also supported.
